In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **K** serves the following purposes:

- k represents a [kobold](/wiki/Kobold "Kobold"):

  - k [kobold](/wiki/Kobold "Kobold")
  - k [large kobold](/wiki/Large_kobold "Large kobold")
  - k [kobold lord](/wiki/Kobold_lord "Kobold lord")
  - k [kobold shaman](/wiki/Kobold_shaman "Kobold shaman")

* K represents a [Keystone Kop](/wiki/Keystone_Kop "Keystone Kop"):

  - K [Keystone Kop](/wiki/Keystone_Kop "Keystone Kop")
  - K [Kop Sergeant](/wiki/Kop_Sergeant "Kop Sergeant")
  - K [Kop Lieutenant](/wiki/Kop_Lieutenant "Kop Lieutenant")
  - K [Kop Kaptain](/wiki/Kop_Kaptain "Kop Kaptain")

- It is also used as a [direction](/wiki/Direction "Direction") key if [numpad](/wiki/Numpad "Numpad") movement is off:

  - Press [k]() to move north.
  - Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [k]() to move far north.

* If numpad is on:
  - Press [k]() to [kick](/wiki/Kick "Kick").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and from [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0") to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), [killer bees](/wiki/Killer_bee "Killer bee") used the k glyph, while kobolds used the K glyph. The Keystone Kop first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d"), and from this version to NetHack 2.3e would appear using the K glyph in place of the kobold if the KOPS [compile-time option](/wiki/Compile-time_option "Compile-time option") was defined.

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the other types of kobold are introduced, and all kobolds are moved to the k glyph, while killer bees are moved to the a glyph; the Keystone Kops' higher ranks are introduced, and the monsters retain the K glyph, though they remain a compile-time option.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces new monsters that use the k glyph:

- k kobold:

  - k [swamp kobold](/wiki/Swamp_kobold "Swamp kobold")
  - k [rock kobold](/wiki/Rock_kobold "Rock kobold")
  - k [kobold warrior](/wiki/Kobold_warrior "Kobold warrior")
  - k [Kroo the Kobold King](/wiki/Kroo_the_Kobold_King "Kroo the Kobold King")

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the Keystone Kops are replaced with the [Keter Sephiroth](/wiki/Keter_Sephiroth "Keter Sephiroth") as K, and one additional monster is introduced that uses the k glyph:

- k kobold:
  - k [winged kobold](/wiki/Winged_kobold "Winged kobold")

- K Keter Sephiroth

  - K [Malkuth Sephirah](/index.php?title=Malkuth_Sephirah\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Malkuth Sephirah (page does not exist)")
  - K [Yesod Sephirah](/index.php?title=Yesod_Sephirah\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Yesod Sephirah (page does not exist)")
  - K [Daat Sephirah](/index.php?title=Daat_Sephirah\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Daat Sephirah (page does not exist)")
  - K [Hod Sephirah](/index.php?title=Hod_Sephirah\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hod Sephirah (page does not exist)")
  - K [Gevurah Sephirah](/index.php?title=Gevurah_Sephirah\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gevurah Sephirah (page does not exist)")
  - K [Binah Sephirah](/index.php?title=Binah_Sephirah\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Binah Sephirah (page does not exist)")
  - K [Chokhmah Sephirah](/index.php?title=Chokhmah_Sephirah\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Chokhmah Sephirah (page does not exist)")

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds one new monster that uses the K glyph:

- K Keystone Kop
  - K [Korrupt Kop](/wiki/Korrupt_Kop "Korrupt Kop")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

K

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter K serves the following purposes:

  • k represents a kobold:
    • k kobold
    • k large kobold
    • k kobold lord
    • k kobold shaman
  • K represents a Keystone Kop:
    • K Keystone Kop
    • K Kop Sergeant
    • K Kop Lieutenant
    • K Kop Kaptain
  • It is also used as a direction key if numpad movement is off:
    • Press k to move north.
    • Press shift + k to move far north.
  • If numpad is on:
    • Press k to kick.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 dNetHack
    • 2.3 SpliceHack

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, and from Hack 1.0 to NetHack 2.3e, killer bees used the k glyph, while kobolds used the K glyph. The Keystone Kop first appears in NetHack 1.3d, and from this version to NetHack 2.3e would appear using the K glyph in place of the kobold if the KOPS compile-time option was defined.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the other types of kobold are introduced, and all kobolds are moved to the k glyph, while killer bees are moved to the a glyph; the Keystone Kops' higher ranks are introduced, and the monsters retain the K glyph, though they remain a compile-time option.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces new monsters that use the k glyph:

  • k kobold:
    • k swamp kobold
    • k rock kobold
    • k kobold warrior
    • k Kroo the Kobold King

dNetHack

In dNetHack, the Keystone Kops are replaced with the Keter Sephiroth as K, and one additional monster is introduced that uses the k glyph:

  • k kobold:
    • k winged kobold
  • K Keter Sephiroth
    • K Malkuth Sephirah
    • K Yesod Sephirah
    • K Daat Sephirah
    • K Hod Sephirah
    • K Gevurah Sephirah
    • K Binah Sephirah
    • K Chokhmah Sephirah

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds one new monster that uses the K glyph:

  • K Keystone Kop
    • K Korrupt Kop
